column1: #Text=Polycrystalline Li1.1Cu0.9S was obtained by the reaction of Li foil (99.999%) with CuS powder (anhydrous, 99.999%) both from Sigma Aldrich, close to 1:1 stoichiometry, but with a slight excess of Li.
#Text=A mixture of the starting materials was pressed into pellets and placed in Al2O3 tubes (∅ 14 mm, Al23, Friatec).
#Text=The total mass was ∼1 g per sample.
#Text=Each crucible was enclosed by an evacuated and with 300 mbar Ar backfilled fused silica ampoule.
#Text=All handling was performed in a glove-box in Ar atmosphere (Braun, pO2, pH2O < 1 ppm) as protecting atmosphere.

#Text=The heat treatment was as follows: After increasing the temperature of the mixture to 723 K at a heating rate of 1 K/min, the temperature was held at 723 K for 96 h and then reduced to room temperature at a cooling rate of 1 K/min.
#Text=After the reaction, a yellow, air- and moisture-sensitive powder was obtained.
#Text=The optical microscopy revealed small Cu particles as a second phase.

#Text=The sample was characterized using powder X-ray diffraction (3° < 2θ < 100°, Huber Gunier camera 670, Cu Kα1-radiation, λ = 1.54051 Å, transmission geometry, Ge monochromator, flat sample holder with Kapton foil).
#Text=Refinement of the lattice parameter: LaB6 as internal standard (SRM660a, a = 4.156916 Å).
